comment: Professor Stephenson Reaves is one of the kindest, enthusiastic professors I've ever had. She truly exudes positivity and kindness and loves science. All of the tests/quizzes/exams are online and taken on the weekends. The workload is completely reasonable, and as long as you participate, this class is an easy A. Totally would recommend her.

A hybrid course, so every week you'd have a module, lab, quiz, and/or a summary model. Workload can seem pretty heavy, but if you stay on top of the work & organized, it won't be too bad! During class, they'd be a PowerPoint lecture, she'd go over the lab, & have a super engaging activity. Quizzes do have Lockdown Brower, but there are open notes!

She was super nice and helpful. I learned a lot from this class. She made class pretty fun and engaging. 
She was slow to grade. The labs were sometimes difficult (especially the online labs). The workload was sometimes heavy, but manageable if you stay organized.

Dr. Stephenson Reaves is one of the sweetest professors one could ever have. She's very understanding and patient, you can tell she truly cares for her students. Workload is a bit heavy but it is manageable if you stay on top of it, it's impossible to fail this class unless you actively want to fail it. Extra credit is also given at the end!
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: I took her in person. By reading the other reviews, i would 100% recommend her in person class compared to her online classes. I can see how many people can fall behind in her online course. There are weekly assignments but by being in her class, you will stay on top of things. Her class is honestly fun and she is funny and into teaching ISCI 2001.

She is an amazing professor, i do NOT recommend taking this course online!! it is a very very very large work load but she is very passionate in this topic. it was not hard just about 5 large assignments due a week. so if you can handle that ur good. shes great just tons of work

I would 100% recommend her class. I took it online and although she has a lot of assignments and work, she does everything in her power to help you succeed. She's very kind with grading and genuinely wants to see you do well. The majority of the work was easy labs. She offers extra credit for exams and is very quick to respond to emails.

I would take Dr. Jessica Reaves again. She is an amazing professor. This class is easy if you go to class. There is a lot of work for this class. She doesn't just do powerpoints which I love. She does activities hands on in class and helps you on the labs in class.

She is absolutely amazing!! I loved taking this class and she is my absolute favorite professor. Extra credit is offered after exams but they're pretty easy so you probably won't need it. Dr. Stephenson Reaves makes learning fun and I'm always excited to show up to class. I wish I could take her for all of my classes!!

Dr. Stephenson Reaves is awesome! She's so sweet and teaches in a really fun/interactive way. Material isn't hard but it can be a lot. The only thing is I don't think there's enough time to complete assignments. Most things are due on Wed. or Fri. nights, which doesn't give you much time. She is really nice, fun, and understanding. Great teacher.

This professor is amazing. This has to be my favorite class so far. She cares about you in and outside the classroom. She makes her class interesting and engaging. Her test and quizzes are on lockdown with no camera. Her exams and quizzes are open note. Do labs in class. I like that this professor doesn't just do PowerPoint during her class.
The material in this class was difficult but the professor was very helpful. She would answer my emails fast even at midnight sometimes.
She's amazing! The class is not too hard, tests are open note and all the labs are done together in class. She's so caring and you can tell she really cares about you and what she is teaching.

LOVE HER!!! I missed class sometimes and I was never penalized for it by her but I did struggle on assessments. I recommend that you go to class as she does an amazing job thoroughly explaining the content.

Dr. Reaves is AMAZING! She is caring and is so willing to help you if you feel like you are struggling. She cares about you as a person and your grade. She offers extra credit through the year and also drops your lowest quiz grade. She is an easy grader and wants you to do well and she is very passionate about science. I would 100% take her again!
Loved her! If you have the opportunity to take her please do! She is so sweet and her class is so fun! We did lots of little games and in class experiments to keep us engaged.

Seems to be a good professor, but it is only the second week and there is lots of different assignments going on & professor also uses LOCK DOWN BROWSER FOR EXAMS.  (I did not see a review stating this prior to taking this course)
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: Not her fault that the material was too complicated for elementary level science, but it was predictable. I felt like she in particular made it seem like we NEEDED to know the depths of these topics even though you didn't learn them yourself till highschool. Tests are all open response and timed. Lots of work but mirrors ISCI2002 format-wise.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: This online course in general relies on long and tedious modules and labs and assignments. Same format every week, very predictable, you learn to manage. She mostly grades for completion so when the burnout hits, just put random stuff to say you did it. I feel like I learned a bit but it's way too complicated for elementary-level science.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: I took her online and it was good for the first few weeks. She struggled with grading and didn't give detailed feedback, but all you had to do was modules and easy quizzes. The labs were easy as long as you give yourself enough time to do them. For big assignments and tests she gave detailed videos that were extremely helpful.

I loved this class and she is very passionate about the subject. There are a lot of assignments due every week however they aren't tough and can actually be helpful. She is very nice and understanding and isn't too hard of a grader. Her exams consist of mostly short answer questions but everything is open note. I would definitely recommend.
